titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kings County lien law 1986.034
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-08-08 20:35:34 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: A booklet containing the text of a Kings County lien law passed on June 8, 1853. The law permitted building contractors to place a lien on the owner's building and/or materials or land on which the contractors worked.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1986.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kings County lien law, 1853, 1986.034; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A booklet containing the text of a Kings County lien law passed on June 8, 1853. The law permitted building contractors to place a lien on the owner's building and/or materials or land on which the contractors worked.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

controlaccess.subject: Real estate business -- Law and legislation -- New York (State) -- Kings County
